verses.text: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, \add even\add* a lamentation , O house of Israel.
The virgin of Israel is fallen ; she shall no more rise : she is forsaken upon her land ; \add there is\add* none to raise her up.

For thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; The city that went out \add by\add* a thousand shall leave an hundred , and that which went forth \add by\add* an hundred shall leave ten , to the house of Israel. \p
¶ For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto the house of Israel , Seek ye me, and ye shall live :
But seek not Beth-el , nor enter into Gilgal , and pass not to Beer-sheba : for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity , and Beth-el shall come to nought.

Seek the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and ye shall live ; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph , and devour \add it\add*, and \add there be\add* none to quench \add it\add* in Beth-el.
Ye who turn judgment to wormwood , and leave off righteousness in the earth ,

\add Seek him\add* that maketh the seven stars and Orion , and turneth the shadow of death into the morning , and maketh the day dark with night : that calleth for the waters of the sea , and poureth them out upon the face of the earth : The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* his name :
That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong , so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.\f + \fr 5.9 \ft spoiled: Heb. spoil\f*
They hate him that rebuketh in the gate , and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

Forasmuch therefore as your treading \add is\add* upon the poor , and ye take from him burdens of wheat : ye have built houses of hewn stone , but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards , but ye shall not drink wine of them.\f + \fr 5.11 \ft pleasant…: Heb. vineyards of desire\f*

For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins : they afflict the just , they take a bribe , and they turn aside the poor in the gate \add from their right\add*.\f + \fr 5.12 \ft a bribe: or, a ransom\f*
Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time ; for it \add is\add* an evil time.
Seek good , and not evil , that ye may live : and so the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of hosts , shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
Hate the evil , and love the good , and establish judgment in the gate : it may be that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph. \p

Therefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of hosts , the Lord , saith thus; Wailing \add shall be\add* in all streets ; and they shall say in all the highways , Alas ! alas ! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning , and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
And in all vineyards \add shall be\add* wailing : for I will pass through thee, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Woe unto you that desire the day of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*! to what end \add is\add* it for you? the day of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add is\add* darkness , and not light.
As if a man did flee from a lion , and a bear met him; or went into the house , and leaned his hand on the wall , and a serpent bit him.
\add Shall\add* not the day of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add be\add* darkness , and not light ? even very dark , and no brightness in it? \p
¶ I hate , I despise your feast days , and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.\f + \fr 5.21 \ft in…: or, your holy days\f*

Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings , I will not accept \add them:\add* neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.\f + \fr 5.22 \ft peace…: or, thank offerings\f*
Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs ; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
But let judgment run down as waters , and righteousness as a mighty stream.\f + \fr 5.24 \ft run: Heb. roll\f*
Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years , O house of Israel ?
But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images , the star of your god , which ye made to yourselves.\f + \fr 5.26 \ft the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king\f*
Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, whose name \add is\add* The God of hosts.
